column1: Baby Barnaby's////This restaurant was very bohemian. There was a wait and not knowing the local custom spent a minute looking for a hostess before a waiter told me just to sign myself in on a clip board hanging on the wall. Okay fine not a problem. While i was waiting there was a serve yourself coffee station. Pretty cool. There was a sign "coffee is not complimentary take your cup to the table" aw man
column2: minus one. The waitress called us
column3: and recruited my assistance in putting two tables together to accommodate our party of six..... Okay I guess. The service after that was pretty on point
column4: and the standard breakfast/brunch fare was very fresh and well executed. The oj was fresh squeezed. I would absolutely eat there again. Just don't expect some five star attraction or anything.
